intro: Symplocos sararensis, commonly known as the Sararensis waxtree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as montane forests. Symplocos sararensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
